instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no keyboard trackpad or fan spin.
threads.message:
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> retina not sure the exact board model number yet, (have not pulled it out the case yet).
It powers on fine and runs everything, except i have no fan spin (tested with a working one)  and also no keyboard or trackpad,  i tried testing with another keyboard but it didn't work. is there any common components for theses issues or am i going to need to track it down between each line?

Thanks

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no keyboard trackpad or fan spin.
threads.message: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> has 2 fans, are we sure we are talking about an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> here?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no keyboard trackpad or fan spin.
threads.message: yeah your right,  someone set a diff retina cover on it.  it is a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board number <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> A

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no keyboard trackpad or fan spin.
threads.message: 4924 does NOT spin the fan until the CPU gets warmer. Try another trackpad flex/trackpad in general cable is super common failure point on 4924
